asanas.name: Uttanasana - उत्तानासन
instruction: 1. Stand tall with feet together.
2. With open eyes bend forward.
3. Inhale and exhale by the nose.
4. Observe the air going in and out.
5. Listen to the sounds around you.
6. Relax, observe the world upsidown

asanas.name: Balasana - बालासन
instruction: 1. On your knees with feet together.
2. Bend forward with eyes open.
3. Inhale and exhale by the nose.
4. Observe the air going in and out.
5. Listen to the sounds around you.
6. Relax, let yourself melt in the floor.

asanas.name: Paschimottanasana - पश्चिमोत्तानासन
asanas.benefits: Paschim = back / uttana =  intense / Asana = pose
instruction: 1. On the floor with leg strecthed.
2. Bend forward with eyes open.
3. Inhale and exhale by the nose.
4. Observe the air going in and out.
5. Listen to the sounds around you.
6. Relax, see your legs.

asanas.name: Ustrasana - उष्ट्रआसन
instruction: 1. On your knees, bend backwards.
2. Reach your heels with your hands.
3. Inhale and exhale by the nose.
4. Observe the air going in and out.
5. Listen to the sounds around you.
6. Pay attention to your chest opening.

asanas.name: Bhujangasana - भूजंगासन
instruction: 1. On the floor facing down.
2. Bend backwards, use your hands.
3. Inhale and exhale by the nose.
4. Observe the air going in and out.
5. Listen to the sounds around you.
6. Observe and enjoy the strecth.

asanas.name: Marjariasana - मार्जरीआसन
instruction: 1. Knees and hands on the floor.
2. Arch your spine backwards.
3. Inhale and exhale by the nose.
4. Observe the air going in and out.
5. Listen to the sounds around you.
6. Relax, forget the past and the future.

asanas.name: Marichyasana - मरीच्यासन
instruction: 1. On the floor, one leg streched, the other bent.
2. Twist to the right, after to the left.
3. Inhale and exhale by the nose.
4. Observe the air going in and out.
5. Listen to the sounds around you.
6. Relax with each exhalation.

asanas.name: Parivrtta Trikonasana - परिवृत्तत्रिकोणासन
instruction: 1. Standing with legs open shoulder width.
2. Twist to the right then to the left.
3. Inhale and exhale by the nose.
4. Observe the air going in and out.
5. Listen to the sounds around you.
6. Observe the exterior world.

asanas.name: Marjariasana - मार्जरीआसन
instruction: 1. Stand with legs open shoulder width.
2. Twist first to the right then to the left.
3. Inhale and exhale by the nose.
4. Observe the air going in and out.
5. Listen to the sounds around you.
6. Be in the moment.

asanas.name: Trikonasana - त्रिकोणासन
instruction: 1. Stand with legs open shoulder width.
2. Bend to the right then to the left.
3. Inhale and exhale by the nose.
4. Observe the air going in and out.
5. Listen to the sounds around you.
6. Be in the moment.

asanas.name: Utthita Parshvakonasana - उत्थितपार्श्वकोणासन
asanas.benefits: Utthita = extended / Parsva = side / Kona = angle
instruction: 1. Stand with legs open shoulder width.
2. Bend to the right then to the left.
3. Inhale and exhale by the nose.
4. Observe the air going in and out.
5. Listen to the sounds around you.
6. Be in the moment.

asanas.name: Parighasana - परिघासन
instruction: 1. Stand with legs open shoulder width.
2. Bend to the right then to the left.
3. Inhale and exhale by the nose.
4. Observe the air going in and out.
5. Listen to the sounds around you.
6. Be in the moment.

asanas.name: Viparita Karani - विपरीत करणी
instruction: 1. Laying in the floor, bend your rips
2. Support the lower back with your hands.
3. Inhale and exhale by the nose.
4. Observe the air going in and out.
5. Listen to the sounds around you.
6. You can also practice against the wall.

asanas.name: Halasana - हलासन
instruction: 1. Lay in your back.
2. Bring your legs behind your head.
3. Inhale and exhale by the nose.
4. Observe the air going in and out.
5. Listen to the sounds around you.
6. Observe how easy is to breath in this poture.

asanas.name: Sarvangasana - सर्वाङ्गासन
instruction: 1. Laying in the floor, raise your legs
2. Support your lower back with your hands.
3. Inhale and exhale by the nose.
4. Observe the air going in and out.
5. Listen to the sounds around you.
6. Observe the reverser breathing process.
